circumstances: On approach to George Town Airport, following an uneventful flight from Lakeland, FL, both engines failed. The crew made a forced landing off airport on water approximately 7 miles from the destination. Both occupants were rescued while the airplane was lost.
probable_cause:
Engine failure caused by inadequate preflight preparation. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Improper in-flight decisions, 
- Miscalculated fuel consumption, 
- Fuel exhaustion, 
- Aircraft came to rest in water, 
- Complete engine failure both engines.
